intro: Hieracium sundense, commonly known as the Sund Strait hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It has hairy, basal leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Hieracium sundense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to temperate climates.
